comment._content: Norman E. Mack was Chairman of the Democratic National Committee and a newspaper publisher from Buffalo, NY . query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9905E6DE173CE633A... Here is Mr. Mack's obit: select.nytimes.com/mem/archive/pdf?res=F10912F8345516738D...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Democratic Party pols visiting Governor Woodrow Wilson of New Jersey, at the New Jersey resort town of Sea Girt, at the time of Wilson's nomination as the Democratic candidate for President of the U. S., in the election of 1912. In the tradition of that era, Wilson did not attend the Convention (which was held in Baltimore), but waited coyly at New Jersey's "Little White House" -- the summertime governor's mansion -- for delegations from the convention to "notify" him of the nomination. They no doubt caught him by complete surprise.

Another Bain/LOC photo of that occasion:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3379428162/]
